extension.dc:title: Extended Measurement Or Facts
extension.name: ExtendedMeasurementOrFact
extension.dc:description: Support for generic measurements or facts, extended version linking to occurrences. This extension (eMoF) was developed to be used in combination with the Event Core, but is also compatible with other cores. When used with Event Core it allows to create an additional link between the eMoF and the occurrence extension. The eMoF can store measurements or facts related to a biological occurrence, environmental measurements or facts and sampling method attributes. This extension also provides the option to provide identifiers to reference a vocabulary for the measurementType, measurementValue and measurementUnit fields.

property.name: measurementID
property.dc:description: An identifier for the MeasurementOrFact (information pertaining to measurements, facts, characteristics, or assertions). May be a global unique identifier or an identifier specific to the data set.

property.name: occurrenceID
property.dc:description: The identifier of the occurrence the measurement or fact refers to. If not applicable, it should be left empty.

property.name: measurementType
property.dc:description: The nature of the measurement, fact, characteristic, or assertion. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.
property.examples: "tail length", "temperature", "trap line length", "survey area", "trap type", "Dry weight biomass", "Sampling instrument name"

property.name: measurementTypeID
property.dc:description: An identifier for the measurementType (global unique identifier, URI). The identifier should reference the measurementType in a vocabulary.

property.name: measurementValue
property.dc:description: The value of the measurement, fact, characteristic, or assertion.

property.name: measurementValueID
property.dc:description: An identifier for facts stored in the column measurementValue (global unique identifier, URI). This identifier can reference a controlled vocabulary (e.g. for sampling instrument names, methodologies, life stages) or reference a methodology paper with a DOI. When the measurementValue refers to a value and not to a fact, the measurementvalueID has no meaning and should remain empty.

property.name: measurementAccuracy
property.dc:description: The description of the potential error associated with the measurementValue.

property.name: measurementUnit
property.dc:description: The units associated with the measurementValue. Recommended best practice is to use the International System of Units (SI).

property.name: measurementUnitID
property.dc:description: An identifier for the measurementUnit (global unique identifier, URI). The identifier should reference the measurementUnit in a vocabulary.

property.name: measurementDeterminedDate
property.dc:description: The date on which the MeasurementOrFact was made. Recommended best practice is to use an encoding scheme, such as ISO 8601:2004(E).

property.name: measurementDeterminedBy
property.dc:description: A list (concatenated and separated) of names of people, groups, or organizations who determined the value of the MeasurementOrFact.
property.examples: "Javier de la Torre", "Julie Woodruff; Eileen Lacey"

property.name: measurementMethod
property.dc:description: A description of or reference to (publication, URI) the method or protocol used to determine the measurement, fact, characteristic, or assertion.
property.examples: "minimum convex polygon around burrow entrances" for a home range area, "barometric altimeter" for an elevation

property.name: measurementRemarks
property.dc:description: Comments or notes accompanying the MeasurementOrFact.
